perturbation.original_text: "All Products manufactured, packaged and delivered to Heritage or Jasper under the terms of this Agreement shall conform to the specifications supplied to Heritage by Premier as listed on Schedule A and/or Schedule A-1, which Schedules may from time to time be modified by Premier in writing (the "Specifications"), shall conform to Post Holding's Quality Expectations Manual attached hereto as Schedule E, and shall conform in all material respects to samples previously supplied to Premier by Heritage."
perturbation.changed_text: "All Products manufactured, packaged and delivered to Heritage or Jasper under the terms of this Agreement should endeavor to conform to the specifications supplied to Heritage by Premier as listed on Schedule A and/or Schedule A-1, which Schedules may from time to time be modified by Premier in writing (the "Specifications"), should also generally conform to Post Holding's Quality Expectations Manual attached hereto as Schedule E, and should aim to conform to samples previously supplied to Premier by Heritage."
perturbation.explanation: The modifications introduce ambiguity by replacing 'shall conform' with 'should endeavor to conform,' 'shall conform' with 'should also generally conform', and 'shall conform' with 'should aim to conform'. This weakens the obligation, making adherence to specifications, quality expectations, and samples discretionary rather than mandatory. The word 'generally' adds to the uncertainty around the quality expectations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Food Safety Modernization Act (FSMA) and Current Good Manufacturing Practice (CGMP) regulations, which require strict adherence to specifications to ensure food safety.

perturbation.original_text: "Heritage shall purchase all ingredients and packaging materials identified in the relevant Schedule C or Schedule C-l to be used in connection with the manufacturer of the Products. Heritage shall invoice Premier through the [***] billing as identified on the relevant Schedule C or Schedule C-l. Heritage shall not, however, purchase ingredients or packaging materials in excess of those required [***]."
perturbation.changed_text: "Heritage will generally purchase ingredients and packaging materials from suppliers of its choosing to be used in connection with the manufacturer of the Products, materials from suppliers of its choosing that are identified in the relevant Schedule C or Schedule C-l. Heritage will invoice Premier through the [***] billing, materials from suppliers of its choosing as identified on the relevant Schedule C or Schedule C-l. However, Heritage may purchase ingredients or packaging materials in excess of those it deems reasonably necessary [***]."
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'shall purchase' to 'will generally purchase' and including 'from suppliers of its choosing' introduces ambiguity regarding the source and type of materials purchased. By stating 'Heritage may purchase ingredients or packaging materials in excess of those it deems reasonably necessary,' it creates a vague exception to the materials required. This creates uncertainty about compliance with material specifications.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Food Safety Modernization Act (FSMA) and associated regulations regarding supplier verification and quality control to ensure safe food production.

perturbation.original_text: "Heritage shall charge Premier [***] as set forth in the relevant Schedule C or Schedule C-1."
perturbation.changed_text: "Heritage will, in good faith, aim to charge Premier [***] generally in accordance with the guidance provided in the relevant Schedule C or Schedule C-1."
perturbation.explanation: The modifications replace the mandatory 'shall charge' with the weaker 'will, in good faith, aim to charge generally in accordance with the guidance'. This introduces significant ambiguity, suggesting that the pricing outlined in Schedule C or C-1 might not be strictly adhered to, which contradicts the initial obligation
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of contract/failure to adhere to contractual agreement with set payment guidelines.
